title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Wednesday 4 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: cornwall 's main hospitals braced for critical cqc report .
two injured in cylinder explosion on dredger off cornwall .
knife school head writes to reassure parents .
high court let plymouth hospital force treatment on teenage overdose victim .
people in penzance say lack of police presence has left them `` feeling unsafe '' .
boris johnson lybia comments 'crass and poorly judged ' - totnes mp .
mineshaft fall man `` did n't think he 'd make it out alive '' .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall today , but we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all thursday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss spotlight with justin leigh and victoria graham at 18:30 on bbc one and the late bulletin at 22:30 .

documents.title: rescued mine fall man in cornwall 'cried when i saw the sky '
text: a man who was rescued after falling deep into a disused mine has said he did n't think he 'd make it out alive .
andrew williams from wales , who fell 50ft ( 15m ) on to a ledge at a mine near st just in cornwall , said `` i really did n't think i 'd come out of there '' .
a huge team of rescuers worked for six hours to get the 51-year-old out safely , with andrew adding `` i can not thank them enough '' .
he remains in hospital in plymouth recovering from serious injuries to his pelvis .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: pheasants 'most likely species ' to die on uk roads
text: pheasants are the bird species most likely to be run over on uk roads , research involving devon-based scientists suggests .
there has been a big rise in the number of pheasants being bred for shooting across the uk over the past 50 years .
the study in royal society open science journal says these captive bred pheasants are 12 times more likely than other species to end up as road kill .
university of exeter researchers found pheasants were most likely to be killed on the roads in autumn and spring .
author: Matt McGrath
Environment correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: devon and cornwall weather : rain clearing to bring sunny spells
text: after a dry evening , it will become windy overnight with a band of rain moving south later .
however , it will feel milder than the previous night .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
early rain will clear southwards tomorrow , bringing drier and brighter conditions will follow with sunny spells for most .
feeling cool however , in a brisk northwesterly wind , with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
join me for a full weather forecast in spotlight tonight at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: cylinder explosion boat suffers 'substantial damage '
text: a boat which was reported to have a compressed cylinder explode on board while off cornwall suffered `` substantial damage '' , the rnli says .
the boat , believed to be a survey vessel , called for help just after 13:00 while working south of dodman point .
two casualties were airlifted to derriford hospital in plymouth by coastguard helicopter and the fowey lifeboat towed the vessel into harbour .
falmouth 's lifeboat took a third uninjured crew member to shore .
james milledge , of the rnli , said the commercial vessel was `` now back in harbour and will undergo a survey '' .
the marine accident investigation branch has been informed of the incident .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: former footballer 's bid to save the planet
text: a former manchester united player is running what 's thought to be the uk 's first zero-waste food shop in totnes .
twenty-eight-year-old richard eckersley , who made his professional debut at old trafford nine years ago , said when he realised fooball was `` just a sport '' , his passion for it died .
at his shop , earth.food.love , customers bring their own jars , bags , bottles and boxes so they can buy raw materials without packaging .
the former defender said , much as he enjoyed his life as a professional player , he had no regrets

`` football 's incredible , in the sense that it connects people all over the world but if we do n't have a planet to live on , and it 's not thriving and it 's not healthy , then football does n't matter .
it does n't make a difference any more , '' he said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: roadworks boss says 'motorists are not traffic experts '
text: the man in charge of traffic issues in plymouth has had a pop at drivers who claim to be know it all 'traffic experts ' .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: mebyon kernow 's dick cole celebrates 20th year as leader
text: cornwall councillor dick cole is celebrating his 20th year as leader of mebyon kernow , making him wht 's believed to be britain 's longest serving leader of any political party .
the party 's fortunes have wavered over the years : it currently has four councillors on the county 's unitary authority , but is yet to win a parliamentary seat .
dick said people had to work hard , and persevere .
he added : `` the highlight for me is being able to to do so much for my local community '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: high court let medics use 'restraint ' to save girl
text: the high court gave medics emergency permission to use `` physical or chemical restraint '' to save the life of a 14-year-old girl suffering from a drugs overdose at derriford hospital .
details of the incident on 26 july were revealed when high court judge mr justice macdonald published the ruling .
he said hospital bosses asked a barrister to make the out-of-hours application to the court as they thought the girl might die if she was not treated .

the barrister rang the judge , who is based in the family division of the high court in london , and hearing was held shortly after 19:00 , with barrister sophia roper outlining the doctors ' fears over the phone .
mr justice macdonald said the teenager could not be identified , but said bosses at plymouth hospitals nhs trust had made the application .
author: Press Association

documents.title: gang of yobs trash cars on way to mcdonalds in rampage
text: `` numerous '' vehicles were vandalised in a quiet plymouth suburb over the weekend - and it 's becoming regular occurrence , says one resident .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: football : wylde aims to keep place in argyle side
text: plymouth argyle winger gregg wylde is hopeful he can keep his place in the side after the club beat exeter city 5-3 on penalties in the efl trophy .
wylde has made just one league start this season in the loss at bristol city on saturday .
`` i 've been biding my time , '' wylde said after tuesday night 's 2-2 draw .
`` i came on against wigan and i thought i did ok , but i started on saturday and again tonight so hopefully i can keep my place in the team . ''
wylde returned to home park in the summer having left a year earlier to join millwall following the pilgrims failure to win the league two play-off final .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: dust off your dancing shoes and party with pudsey !
text: who 's up for a party ? !
we 're having a disco for @ twitterid and you 're all invited !
hear all about it with @ twitterid tomorrow
me !
me !
wooooooo !

documents.title: survey boat being towed to shore after cylinder explosion
text: a boat which was reported to have a compressed cylinder explode on board while off cornwall is believed to be a survey vessel .
the vessel called for help just after 13:00 while working just south of dodman point .
a coastguard helicopter , falmouth lifeboat , a royal navy fleet auxiliary ship and a fishery protection vessel immediately headed to the scene .
coastguards said two casualties had been taken to derriford hospital in plymouth and the fowey lifeboat was towing the vessel into harbour .
falmouth 's lifeboat was assisting with the tow after taking a third uninjured crew member to shore , they added .
the marine accident investigation branch has been informed of the incident .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: strike action could disrupt devonport
text: there could be disruption at devonport - and other docks and ports in the uk - if port workers vote to strike .
the unite union is balloting members on industrial action after it rejected what 's been described as a `` derisory '' pay offer from serco marine services .
if tug boat crews vote to strike , it could affect the movement of royal navy ships .
portsmouth could also be affected ; while , in scotland , the action could affect ports in greenock , faslane and kyle .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: gang admits robbing security van and trying to rip cashpoints out of shops
text: a gang has admitted robbing a security van and trying to steal cashpoint machines from two coop stores in devon .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: man and dog rescue shown to mark world animal day
text: to mark world animal day , the maritime and coastguard agency has released a video showing one of its helicopters rescuing a man and his dog from a cliff in porlock in north devon .
marking st athan coastguard helicopter 's 2nd anniversary and # worldanimalday footage just in of a man and his dog rescued from a dangerous sliding cliff # porlock # devon
looked ruff .

documents.title: police admit 'more to do ' in penzance after 'wild west ' criticism
text: a senior officer has admitted police have `` more to do '' in penzance following claims a lack of policing is ruining the town .
traders and residents have singed an online petition saying they 're fed up with the level of illegal drug use , saying needles have been found in the town 's streets and parks .
one even described the town as being `` like the wild west '' .
businesswoman carol shaw said penzance was a town with `` lots to offer '' , but it was being ruined by a lack of police officers .
`` we hardly ever see anybody walking up and down , '' she said .
superintendent sara crane , from devon and cornwall police , said she 'd continue to look into levels of policing .
`` it is a focus and priority but there 's certainly more we can do , '' she said .
author: Hannah Stacey
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: five plymouth care homes rated as inadequate
text: five care homes in plymouth have been rated as inadequate after they failed their latest inspections .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: cornish name for new fire boat
text: a new fire boat has been named skath an tanlu - cornish for `` fire boat '' - after a vote by the public .
it was the first purpose-built boat for cornwall fire and rescue service and would be used for maritime incidents , and in partnership with other emergency services , firefighters said .
thanks to all of those who voted on the naming of the new fire boat .
the winning name is skath an tanlu !
more info @

documents.title: high court let hospital force treatment on overdose victim
text: derriford hospital was given permission to use `` physical or chemical restraint '' to treat a 14-year-old girl thought to have taken a drug overdose , it has emerged .

hospital bosses in plymouth asked a barrister to make an urgent out-of-hours application to the high court for permission to restrain the teenager in july after doctors said they were concerned that she might die if not treated .
details of the hearing emerged in a ruling published by mr justice macdonald from the high court 's family division .
the teenager , in the application by plymouth hospital nhs trust , has not been identified .

documents.title: travel update for devon : two accidents in plympton
text: travel update for devon : two accidents in plympton
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: breakingtwo people injured in cylinder explosion on boat
text: two people have been injured in an explosion on board a dredging vessel off cornwall , coastguards say .
coastguards said they received a call from the vessel , about two nautical miles south of dodman point , near mevagissey , just before 13:00 .
the maritime and coastguard agency said : `` it is believed that a compressed air cylinder exploded and two of the three people on board have been injured in the blast . ''
a coastguard helicopter and falmouth lifeboat are on scene evacuating the casualties to derriford hospital in plymouth .
a royal navy fleet auxiliary ship and a fishery protection vessel were also assisting , coastguards added .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: football : exeter boss happy despite argyle trophy loss
text: exeter city manager paul tisdale says he is pleased with how his side played after their 5-3 penalty shootout loss to rivals plymouth argyle in the efl trophy .
tisdale made eight changes to his side which twice took the lead in a 2-2 draw at home park .
`` there were three young players that were making their full senior debut , as well as players who 've been on the fringe of the team , so i 'm really pleased with the way we played .
`` it bodes well for the squad and the confidence of the players who are trying to get into the team . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: structural engineers examine overturned lorry road
text: structural engineers are examining a road near loddiswell which is thought to have partially collapsed yesterday , causing an hgv lorry to overturn and crash down an embankment .
the driver , who escaped serious injury , said his seatbelt saved his life .
loddiswell rake corner to avon mill remains closed .
a crane today will remove over turned hgv & structual engineers will inspect road hg
hi - any updates on this road closure ?
thanks ( rb )
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update for devon and cornwall : a cloudy afternoon with some sunny spells
text: a dry afternoon , but quite cloudy at times , although there should be some bright or sunny periods .
light or moderate winds increasing by the end of the day , with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
some clear periods at first this evening , but from midnight onwards cloud will increase as a band of mostly light rain moves in , with a minimum temperature of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: boris should apologise 'unequivocally ' for sirte comments
text: sarah wollaston , the conservative mp for totnes , says foreign secretary boris johnson should apologise `` unequivocally '' about comments he made on the war-torn libyan city of sirte .
he said if the dead bodies were cleared away , sirte could become the `` next dubai '' .
in an interview on bbc radio four 's today programme , dr wollaston said the foreign secretary 's comments were both crass and poorly judged and he should consider his position .
tory mp @ twitterid calls on boris johnson to `` consider his position '' after his libya 'dead bodies ' comment # r4today

documents.title: knife school head writes to reassure parents
text: the head of penair school in truro has written to parents about an incident on monday involving a pupil with a knife , describing it as `` unprecedented '' .
the 13-year-old girl , who can not be named , has been charged with possessing of an offensive weapon on school grounds , making threats to kill , assault and causing criminal damage .
her case will be heard at a youth court at a later date .
head james davidson said he wanted to give parents `` accurate information '' as facts could often become `` distorted '' after conversations .
in the letter , the head said : `` in nearly 20 years of working in education , i have never experienced an incident like this and hope to never again . ''
mr davidson said the student had been suspended , but legal proceedings meant he was unable to release any further details .
he added the school was `` committed to the safety and education of all our students '' .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: glimmer of hope for dairy farmers
text: dairy farmers could soon see an upturn in fortunes following two years of low prices .
many farmers were being paid less for their milk than it cost to produce and , in the south west alone , more than 200 farms have gone out of business since 2012 .
a report published today says that , thanks to an increase in global demand for milk , profits should begin to rise - although it could take farmers another two years to clear accumulated debts .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: missing dog found after trawler solstice capsized , killing its owner
text: a dog who went missing when a trawler capsized killing its owner and leaving two others in deep shock has been found dead on a cornwall beach .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: cornwall 's main hospitals braced for critical cqc report
text: cornwall 's main hospitals are braced for a critical report from the health watchdog tomorrow .
the care quality commission has already issued a warning notice after inspecting the royal cornwall in treliske , the west cornwall in penzance and st michael 's in hayle .
the royal cornwall hospital 's trust was told earlier this year to make immediate improvements in nine areas - including making sure there was enough staff at all times .
at the time of that warning from the cqc , the trust said it was making improvements .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel : slow traffic in plymouth after belgrave road accident
text: in plymouth , on mutley plain heading inbound , there is slow traffic due to an accident at belgrave road .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: mineshaft fall man 'did n't think i 'd come out of there '
text: a man who sparked a major rescue operation after falling down a disused mineshaft in cornwall has said he did n't think he 'd make it out alive .
andrew williams from south wales was part of an organised walking group when he fell more than 50ft ( 15m ) down the mine near st just 10 days ago .
after a six-hour rescue operation involving more than 50 people , he was airlifted to derriford hospital in plymouth , where he 's recovering from a broken pelvis and spinal injuries .
`` i really did n't think i 'd come out of there , but thankfully i did , '' he said .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: football : ex-torquay assistant boss robbie herrera leaves
text: former torquay united assistant boss robbie herrera has left the club following the recent appointment of head coach gary owers .
the 47-year-old was in caretaker charge prior to owers ' arrival after the sacking of former boss kevin nicholson .
general manager geoff harrop said talks had taken place about a youth development role for herrera .
`` robbie has decided that he is ready for a new challenge , which i fully understand and appreciate , '' he added .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: totnes mp says boris comments 'crass and poorly judged '
text: a conservative mp has said boris johnson 's comments on a war-torn libyan city were `` crass and poorly judged '' .
the foreign secretary said sirte could be the next dubai , adding : `` all they have to do is clear the dead bodies away '' .
his comments at a tory conference fringe meeting has angered many mps , including those in his own party .
totnes conservative mp sarah wollaston said : `` these remarks were crass , poorly judged and grossly insensitive and this is from the person who is representing us on the world stage , '' she said .
`` i think it 's really disappointing . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: lorry crash driver 'saved by seatbelt '
text: the driver of a lorry which overturned and crashed near loddiswell on tuesday says his seatbelt saved his life .
the vehicle overturned during the crash on tuesday .
devon highways bosses said on twitter that loddiswell rake corner to avon mill was still closed and a crane was due to remove the vehicle later before structural engineers inspected the road .
# seatbeltssavelives - the driver of this hgv praised his seatbelt for saving his life as it slid down a bank & overturned # wearit # staysafe
is the incident on the unnamed road at loddiswell ?
loddiswell rake corner to avon mill remains closed .
a crane today will remove over turned hgv & structual engineers will inspect road hg
hi - any updates on this road closure ?
thanks ( rb )

documents.title: tide times for devon and cornwall
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast today , here are the times of high water .
there will be a full weather forecast in the lunchtime news at 13:30 on bbc one and tonight on spotlight at 18:30 .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: man drove wrong way on a38 to kill himself after abuse
text: the son of a 'manipulative sadist ' who physically and sexually abused his family for two decades has revealed he eventually tried to kill himself by driving the wrong way on the a38 .
author: Devon Live

text: # cornwall the gwr service between st ives and st erth has been suspended .
tickets being accepted on local bus routes .

expected to be closed for most of the day .

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : bright with some sunny spells
text: it will be dry and bright with some sunny spells , although the sun may be somewhat hazy in places .
however , later on the cloud will increase from the north and the winds will also strengthen .
maximum temperature 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man arrested after redruth explosion released by police
text: a man from redruth arrested under the explosives act has been released by police while further investigations take place .
officers were called to reports of a small explosion in the town on sunday night , and cordons were set up on monday whilst an explosive ordnance device team assessed the scene .
the incident was not believed to be related to terrorism , police said .
author: Naomi Kennedy
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: suspected arson destroys cricket building
text: a building at westleigh cricket club in north devon has been completely destroyed by a fire , which is thought to have been started deliberately .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said two appliances from bideford were sent to the blaze when the alarm was raised just after 03:00 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: penzance petition calls for improved police presence
text: people living and working in penzance say a lack of police presence to deal with drug dealing and street drinking leaves them feeling unsafe .
in a petition , they 're asking devon and cornwall police and cornwall council to address what they see as big issues , including homelessness , poverty , public safety and drug misuse .
west cornwall police commander supt sara crane said she was continuing to look into levels of policing .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: football : owers urges torquay to stay grounded after win
text: torquay united manager gary owers says he and his players will not get carried away after finally getting a first win of the season .
the gulls beat maidenhead united 4-0 at plainmoor to end a 13-game winless run since the start of the season .
`` we 're not going to jump on an open top bus tomorrow and celebrate three points , but we had to win at some stage , '' owers told bbc radio devon .
`` i 'm thankful , i 'm relieved and hopefully we can move on now . ''
the gulls are still bottom of the national league but managed to score more goals in the first half of tuesday night 's game than they had in their previous six games .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : a30 lane closure near launceston
text: # cornwall in launceston , on a30 eastbound between a388 polson turn off and a386 sourton cross , one lane is closed due to an earlier car fire

documents.title: penair head teacher confirms 'very serious incident '
text: the head teacher of penair school in truro has issued a statement on the very serious incident '' that took place at the school which allegedly involving one of the students and a knife .
author: Cornwall Live

BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: devon schools 'still missing out with funding '
text: schools in devon will still be among the poorest in the country , despite the government 's new funding formula , according to figures seen by the bbc .
last month the conservatives , who run the county council , welcomed extra funding which they said meant devon 's schools budget would get another £ 7.5m a year .
but emails obtained by the bbc said this would only improve funding by £ 22 per pupil , still leaving each school child with £ 268 a year less than the national average .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for wednesday
text: good wednesday morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online
